title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.21 Part 3 | 26-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Ajnana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakcharanmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Sri Vasadi Gauravhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will continue discussing the 21st verse of the 12th chapter of the 1st
Kanto Srimad Bhagavatam. This is part 3 of that same verse.
The third part this is based on the purport by Srila Prabhupada describing the history of
Pandava Arjuna. In previous two sessions we have discussed the history of Pandava Arjuna
as given by Srila Prabhupada in the purport elaborately. So Arjuna married Draupadi in
the Swayamvara ceremony.
So the further description is given by Srila Prabhupada what happens. Just to remind you
of the verse 21st verse.
Dhanvinam agraniresha tulyas charjuna yo dvayoha, hutasya iva durdharsaha, samudra iva dustaraha.
The meaning of this verse is amongst great bowmen this child will be as good as Arjuna.
He will be as irresistible as fire and as unsurpassed.
These are words spoken by the brahmanas who are preparing the horoscope of the child newly
born child Parikshit and at such a time they read the horoscope and foretell the future
of the child because Yudhishthira was anxious that this only surviving descendant of the
entire Kuru dynasty.
Will he be alive?
Will he be as worthy as his forefathers?
That was his anxiety.
So the brahmanas assured him this child is a highly qualified child.
So he was specially protected by Krishna when he was in his mother's womb and he is going
to be an excellent because somebody who is a pure devotee is qualified with all wonderful
qualifications yasyasthi bhakti bhagavati akinchana sarvair gunaistatra samasate suraha.
This statement is in the Bhagavatam that a pure devotee has all good qualities.
Actually every living being a spirit soul has all good qualities but it's only because
we are covered by the material contamination that our good qualities get covered and the
contamination.
which brings forth all kinds of bad qualities. So as spirit soul, nobody is a bad person. No living being is a bad person, a spirit soul.
But we have to purify our consciousness and become free from all the contaminating bad qualities, which are a result of the material contamination in contact with material nature.
So therefore the Bhagavad Gita, Krishna says that by practicing yoga,
Yogam Atma Vishuddhi,
you purify your heart of all the dirty things, then the good qualities will shine forth from a purified heart.
And the process of purification is the process of yoga.
But among the yoga processes, the best process is the process of Bhakti Yoga.
And that Bhakti Yoga also has been simplified further.
Among the different...
Yoga system, Bhakti Yoga is the easiest. But even among the different practices of Bhakti Yoga,
the simplest practice of chanting the holy name of Krishna, Hare Krishna,
Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare, has been
especially taught by Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu
for the fallen souls of this Kali Yuga.
That you simply chant Hare Krishna,
purify your heart of all materials,
purify your heart of all material contamination and become first-class devotees eligible to
become
free from material bondage and go to the spiritual world
where Krishna is engaged in his
wonderful,
loving pastimes with his devotees. Krishna is inviting, come back to me in my personal abode and we qualify
by simply chanting,
Hare Krishna and augmenting this chanting with other few other practices which will enrich our Bhakti.
So the description is being given here about this child, that this child Parikshit will be as expert bowman when he grows up as the grandfather of the child, as the grandfather of the child.
The child Parikshit will be as expert bowman when he grows up as the grandfather of the child as the grandfather of the child.
First is the physical body, then the spiritual body, then the spiritual body.
Then corrective form, Next the supernatural Parikshit.
11, second,
The body,
earlier it was said Arjuna had four sons through four wives so Shrutakirti, Abhimanyu, Babruvahana
and Irawan so Irawan was born through Ulupi and similarly Arjuna met Chitrangada a daughter of
the king of Manipur and thus Babruvahana was born so Srila Prabhupada describing how Arjuna had four
sons through four wives Lord Shri Krishna made a plan to help Arjuna to kidnap Subhadra sister of
Krishna because Baladeva was inclined to hand her over to Duryodhana both Krishna and Balram had one
sister Subhadra
the daughter of Vasudeva and Devaki and both Krishna and Balram are sons of Vasudeva and Devaki
so Balram was inclined to marry his sister Subhadra to Duryodhana Duryodhana was the
student of Balram Balram taught Duryodhana the art of fighting with a club Gada
he was an expert and Duryodhana had become an expert being taught by Balram how to
nicely use that club in a fight in a combat with another Kshatriya but Krishna wanted to hand over
his sister Subhadra to Arjuna so Krishna made a plan how Arjuna can actually kidnap
Subhadra and marry her Yudhishtira also agreed with Krishna's plan and thus Subhadra was forcibly
taken away by Arjuna and married to Arjuna Subhadra's son through Arjuna is Abhimanyu and
And Abhimanyu is the father of Parikshit Maharaj, the son of Abhimanyu and Uttara.
Parikshit is the son of Abhimanyu and Uttara.
But this Abhimanyu, he was killed in the battle of Kurukshetra.
And therefore Parikshit was born as the posthumous child of Abhimanyu.
Then it is also described, so Prabhupada has clearly explained the four sons who were born of the four wives of Arjuna.
Through Draupadi, Arjuna had a son by name Shrutakirti.
Through Subhadra, he had a son by name Abhimanyu.
Through...
Chitrangada, he had a son by name Babruvahana.
And through Ulupi, he had a son by name Irawana.
Further it is described, Arjuna satisfied the fire god, Agnideva, by setting fire to the Khandava forest.
And thus the fire god gave him one weapon.
Arjuna actually was preparing for the big battle of Kurukshetra.
Because the Pandavas were excited.
They were exiled by Duryodhana, when they were cheated in a gambling match.
They were cheated by Duryodhana.
And they were exiled.
So after that exile period was over, Duryodhana refused to give back their kingdom to the Pandavas.
So then war was inevitable.
But in the meantime, during exile, Arjuna actually was...
Preparing.
So he got one weapon from the fire god.
And when the Khandava forest was set on fire, Indra became angry.
And Indra, assisted by all other demigods, began fighting with Arjuna.
Because Arjuna set fire to the forest.
So all the devatas headed by Indra, they were defeated by Arjuna.
And Indra returned to his heavenly kingdom after suffering defeat at the hands of Arjuna.
Then Arjuna also promised protection to one Mayadanava or Mayasura.
And Mayasura...
Being protected by Arjuna actually, he presented one valuable conch shell celebrated as the devadatta.
Similarly, Arjuna received many other valuable weapons from Indradeva.
When Indradeva was satisfied to see the chivalry of Arjuna.
When Yudhishthira...
When Yudhishthira was disappointed in defeating Jarasandha.
Then Arjuna gave assurance to Yudhishthira that...
Arjuna, Bhima and Krishna will go to Magadha to challenge Jarasandha.
And when they went, Bhima was able to kill Jarasandha.
And in that way, Yudhishthira was able to hold the Rajasuya sacrifice.
Then Arjuna also underwent severe types of penances when he was rewarded by Indradeva.
Shiva also once wanted to try the strength of Arjuna.
And Shiva disguised as an aborigin, he met Arjuna.
There is a fight between Shiva disguised as the aborigin and Arjuna.
And Shiva was satisfied with Arjuna's chivalrous nature.
His bravery and his skill in fighting.
And Shiva disclosed his identity.
So, Arjuna prayed to Lord Shiva in all humbleness.
And when Shiva was satisfied with Arjuna's behavior.
Shiva presented his Pashupatastra to Arjuna.
In this way, Arjuna acquired many other important weapons from different devatas.
He got Dandastra from Yamaraj.
He got Pashastra from Varuna.
He got Antaradhanaastra from Kuvera.
And actually, Arjuna was fully equipped to fight that battle of Kurukshetra.
In order to win back Kurukshetra.
Win back the kingdom from Duryodhana.
Even when Duryodhana was under the clutches of some Gandharvas.
That time, Arjuna actually fought against the Gandharvas and released Duryodhana.
And it is also described that.
Arjuna was the one to whom the philosophical discourses on the Bhagavad Gita were spoken by Lord Krishna on the battlefield of Kurukshetra.
And even on the battlefield.
Arjuna fought very very wonderfully against the Kauravas.
And.
Hmm.
After the disappearance of Lord Krishna.
The message was brought by Arjuna to Maharaja Yudhishtira.
And Arjuna actually.
When Vasudeva passed away.
After the disappearance of Krishna.
Then Arjuna performed the funeral ceremony of Vasudeva in the absence of Krishna.
So at last.
When advised by Vasudeva.
All the Pandava brothers headed for Mahaprasthana.
On the way.
At the request of his brother.
Arjuna gave up all important weapons as useless.
And he proceeded.
On Mahaprasthana.
So this is the description of.
The history of the Pandava Arjuna as given by Srila Prabhupada in this purport.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
